item.title: Julia add a quote by Machiavelli Niccolo
item.description: "I'm not interested in preserving the status quo; I want to overthrow it." -- Machiavelli Niccolo

item.title: Julia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julia add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "I want a brighter word than bright" -- John Keats

item.title: Julia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julia add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Julia add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a <i>story</i>." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Julia add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "Dancing music, music sad, Both together, sane and madâ€¦" -- John Keats

item.title: Julia add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "I wish to believe in immortality-I wish to live with you forever." -- John Keats

item.title: Julia add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Julia add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "I had to touch you with my hands, I had to taste you with my tongue; one can't love and do nothing." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Julia add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Julia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I will be calm. I will be mistress of myself." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Julia add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Julia add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "The plain state of being human is dramatic enough for anyone; you don't need to be a heroin addict or a performance poet to experience extremity. You just have to love someone." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Julia add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "Sarcasm and compassion are two of the qualities that make life on Earth tolerable." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Julia add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "If you really wanted to mess me up, you should have got to me earlier." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Julia add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "In other words, it's one of those books you thrust on your partner with an incredulous cry of "This is me!" -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Julia add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "To Sherlock Holmes she is always<i> the</i> woman. I have seldom heard him mention her under any other name." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Julia add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Julia add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "You see, but you do not observe." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Julia add a quote by Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett
item.description: "An Angel who did not so much Fall as Saunter Vaguely Downwards." -- Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett

item.title: Julia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Aziraphale collected books. If he were totally honest with himself he would have to have admitted that his bookshop was simply somewhere to store them. He was not unusual in this. In order to maintain his cover as a typical second-hand book seller, he used every means short of actual physical violence to prevent customers from making a purchase. Unpleasant damp smells, glowering looks, erratic opening hours - he was incredibly good at it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Julia add a quote by Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett
item.description: "She was beautiful, but she was beautiful in the way a forest fire was beautiful: something to be admired from a distance, not up close." -- Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett

item.title: Julia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description:
"The men in the room suddenly realized that they did not want to know her better. She was beautiful, but she was beautiful in the way a forest fire was beautiful: something to be admired from a distance, not up close.
And she held her sword, and she smiled like a knife." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Julia add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Hell may have all the best composers, but heaven has all the best choreographers." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Julia add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "And then there were cats, thought Dog. He'd surprised the huge ginger cat from next door and had attempted to reduce it to cowering jelly by means of the usual glowing stare and deep-throated growl, which had always worked on the damned in the past. This time they had earned him a whack on the nose that had made his eyes water. Cats, Dog considered, were clearly a lot tougher than lost souls. He was looking forward to a further cat experiment, which he planned would consist of jumping around and yapping excitedly at it. It was a long shot, but it just might work." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Julia add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "My dear, I used to think I was serving humanity . . . and I pleasured in the thought. Then I discovered that humanity does not want to be served; on the contrary it resents any attempt to serve it. So now I do what pleases myself." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Julia add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "I would challenge you to a battle of wits, but I see you are unarmed!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Julia add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Though she be but little, she is fierce!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Julia add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Dispute not with her: she is lunatic." -- William Shakespeare
